Detailed Description

Create an empty PathMeasure object.

To uses this to measure the length of a path, and/or to find the position and tangent along it, call setPath.

Note that once a path is associated with the measure object, it is undefined if the path is subsequently modified and the the measure object is used. If the path is modified, you must call setPath with the path. 

 //Create a PathMeasure object initialized with a closed Path p.
 PathMeasure pm(p, true);
 //return contour length of p
 float length = pm.getLength();

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gaia::graphics::PathMeasure::PathMeasure ( )

Create an empty PathMeasure object.

To uses this to measure the length of a path, and/or to find the position and tangent along it, call setPath. Note that once a path is associated with the measure object, it is undefined if the path is subsequently modified and the the measure object is used. If the path is modified, you must call setPath with the path.

virtual gaia::graphics::PathMeasure::~PathMeasure ( ) [virtual]
gaia::graphics::PathMeasure::PathMeasure ( const Path &  path,
bool  forceClosed 
)

Create a PathMeasure object associated with the specified path object (already created and specified).

The meansure object can now return the path's length, and the position and tangent of any position along the path. Note that once a path is associated with the measure object, it is undefined if the path is subsequently modified and the the measure object is used. If the path is modified, you must call setPath with the path.

Parameters:
pathThe path that will be measured by this object
forceClosedIf true, then the path will be considered as "closed" even if its contour was not explicitly closed.

Member Function Documentation

gaia::graphics::PathMeasure::DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN ( PathMeasure  ) [private]
float gaia::graphics::PathMeasure::getLength ( ) const

Return the total length of the current contour, or 0 if no path is associated with this measure object.

bool gaia::graphics::PathMeasure::getMatrix ( float  distance,
Matrix *  matrix,
MatrixFlags  flags 
) const

Pins distance to 0 <= distance <= getLength(), and then computes the corresponding matrix.

Returns false if there is no path, or a zero-length path was specified, in which case matrix is unchanged.

Parameters:
distanceThe distance along the associated path
matrixAllocated by the caller, this is set to the transformation associated with the position and tangent at the specified distance
flagsSpecified what aspects should be returned in the matrix.
bool gaia::graphics::PathMeasure::getPosTan ( float  distance,
PointF *  pos,
PointF *  tan 
) const

Pins distance to 0 <= distance <= getLength(), and then computes the corresponding position and tangent.

Returns false if there is no path, or a zero-length path was specified, in which case position and tangent are unchanged.

Parameters:
distanceThe distance along the current contour to sample
posIf not NULL, returns the sampled position (x==[0], y==[1])
tanIf not NULL, returns the sampled tangent (x==[0], y==[1])
Returns:
false if there was no path associated with this measure object
bool gaia::graphics::PathMeasure::getSegment ( float  startD,
float  stopD,
Path *  dst,
bool  startWithMoveTo 
) const

Given a start and stop distance, return in dst the intervening segment(s).

If the segment is zero-length, return false, else return true. startD and stopD are pinned to legal values (0..getLength()). If startD >= stopD then return false (and leave dst untouched). Begin the segment with a moveTo if startWithMoveTo is true

bool gaia::graphics::PathMeasure::isClosed ( ) const

Return true if the current contour is closed()

bool gaia::graphics::PathMeasure::nextContour ( )

Move to the next contour in the path.

Return true if one exists, or false if we're done with the path.

void gaia::graphics::PathMeasure::setPath ( const Path &  path,
bool  forceClosed 
)

Assign a new path, or null to have none.
